body_html:
When you use FIFOQueue, you don't pass in the batch shape, only the
remainder. For example, if you pass shapes like [None, 10] to
queue.enqueue_many(), you only use shape value [10] for that component.

On Wed, Oct 12, 2016 at 12:57 PM, Yandi Xia notifications@github.com
wrote:

No, actually tf.FIFOQueue() can't take shapes like [None, 10]. Every
dimension needs to be specified.

Is there any way that I can use FIFOQueue with variable batch_size without
losing TensorShape information?

Thanks

—

body:
When you use FIFOQueue, you don't pass in the batch shape, only the
remainder.  For example, if you pass shapes like [None, 10] to
queue.enqueue_many(), you only use shape value [10] for that component.

On Wed, Oct 12, 2016 at 12:57 PM, Yandi Xia notifications@github.com
wrote:

> No, actually tf.FIFOQueue() can't take shapes like [None, 10]. Every
> dimension needs to be specified.
> 
> Is there any way that I can use FIFOQueue with variable batch_size without
> losing TensorShape information?
> 
> Thanks
